3dsts.defHTML: The 3D projection scintillator tracker spectrometer in the near detector conceptual design.
3dsts.defLaTeX: The \threed projection scintillator tracker spectrometer  in the near detector conceptual design

4850l.defHTML: The depth in feet (1480 m) of the access level for the DUNE underground area at SURF; called the "4850 level".
4850l.defLaTeX: The depth in feet (1480 m) of the access level for the DUNE underground area at SURF; called the ``4850 level''

ac.defHTML: Alternating Current; when used in the phrase "AC coupling" refers to a circuit element that filters out low-frequency components, such as constant offsets, leaving higher frequency signal components. The frequency filtering is determined both by a resistor and a capacitor.
ac.defLaTeX: Alternating Current; when used in the phrase ``AC coupling'' refers to a circuit element that filters out low-frequency components, such as constant offsets, leaving higher frequency signal components. The frequency filtering is determined both by a resistor and a capacitor

adc.defHTML: A sampling of a voltage resulting in a discrete integer count corresponding in some way to the input.
adc.defLaTeX: A sampling of a voltage  resulting in a discrete integer count corresponding in some way to  the input

agky.defHTML: A model for hadronization of non-resonant inelastic neutrino reactions used in GENIE. At low invariant hadronic masses, typically less than 2.3 GeV/c2, it is a KNO-inspired empirical model anchored on several bubble chamber measurements of neutrino-induced shower characteristics. For invariant hadronic masses between 2.3 and 3.0 GeV/c2, the model transitions linearly to a GENIE-tuned version of PYTHIA, which is also used for the simulation of events at higher invariant masses.
agky.defLaTeX: A model for hadronization of non-resonant inelastic neutrino reactions used in \gls{genie}. At low invariant hadronic masses, typically less than 2.3\,GeV/c$^2$, it is a KNO-inspired empirical model anchored on several bubble chamber measurements of neutrino-induced shower characteristics. For invariant hadronic masses between 2.3 and 3.0\,GeV/c$^2$, the model transitions linearly to a \gls{genie}-tuned version of PYTHIA, which is also used for the simulation of events at higher invariant masses

ahj.defHTML: An organization, office, or individual responsible for enforcing the requirements of a code or standard, or for approving equipment, materials, an installation, or a procedure (OSHA).
ahj.defLaTeX: An organization, office, or individual responsible for enforcing the requirements of a code or standard, or for approving equipment, materials, an installation, or a procedure (\gls{osha})

alara.defHTML: Typically used with regard management of radiation exposure but may be used more generally. It means making every reasonable effort to maintain e.g., exposures, to as far below the limits as practical, consistent with the purpose for that the activity is undertaken.
alara.defLaTeX: Typically used with regard management of radiation  exposure but may be used more generally. It means making every  reasonable effort to maintain e.g., exposures, to as far below the  limits as practical, consistent with the purpose for that the  activity is undertaken

alice.defHTML: A Large Ion Collider Experiment, at CERN.
alice.defLaTeX: A Large Ion Collider Experiment, at CERN

amc.defHTML: Holds digitizing electronics and lives in μTCA crates.
amc.defLaTeX: Holds digitizing  electronics and lives in \gls{utca} crates

cno.defHTML: The CNO cycle (for carbon-nitrogen-oxygen) is one of the two known sets of fusion reactions by which stars convert hydrogen to helium, the other being the proton-proton chain reaction (pp-chain reaction). In the CNO cycle, four protons fuse, using carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen isotopes as catalysts, to produce one alpha particle, two positrons and two electron neutrinos.

In the CNO cycle, four protons fuse, using carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen isotopes as catalysts, to produce one alpha particle, two positrons and two electron neutrinos

cob.defLaTeX: An ATCA motherboard housing four RCEs

comsol.defLaTeX: General-purpose simulation software based on advanced numerical methods (comsol.com)

cp.defLaTeX: Product of charge conjugation and parity  transformations

croc.defLaTeX: central (radial) readout chamber for the ND \gls{gartpc}

crt.defLaTeX: Detector external to the TPC designed to tag TPC-traversing cosmic ray particles

cryo.defLaTeX: (1) Integrated ASIC including \gls{fe} circuitry providing signal amplification and pulse shaping, analog to digital conversion, and control and communication functionalities for 64 channels; (2) acryonym for cryogenic systems and cryostat work scopes in \gls{lbnf}

ctsf.defHTML: A facility where the the DP photon detectors will be coated, tested, and stored.
ctsf.defLaTeX: A facility where the the \gls{dp} photon detectors will be coated, tested, and stored

cube.defHTML: beryllium copper, used to make FD1-HD APA readout planes.
cube.defLaTeX: beryllium copper, used to make \gls{sphd} \gls{apa} readout planes

cuc.defLaTeX: The utility cavern at the 4850L of \gls{surf} located between the two detector caverns. It contains utilities such as central cryogenics and other systems, and the underground data center and control room

cvmfs.defHTML: A distributed file system designed for scalable, high-performance distribution of software to interactive and batch computers.
cvmfs.defLaTeX: A distributed file system designed for scalable, high-performance distribution of software to interactive and batch computers

cvn.defHTML: An algorithm for identifying neutrino interactions based on their topology and without the need for detailed reconstruction algorithms.
cvn.defLaTeX: An algorithm for identifying neutrino interactions based on their topology and without the need for detailed reconstruction algorithms

daphne.defHTML: Detector electronics for Acquiring PHotons from NEutrinos is a custom-developed warm front-end waveform digitizing electronics module derived from the readout system developed at Fermilab for the Mu2e experiment.
daphne.defLaTeX: Detector electronics for Acquiring PHotons from NEutrinos is a custom-developed warm front-end waveform digitizing electronics module derived from the readout system developed at Fermilab for the Mu2e experiment

daq.defHTML: The data acquisition system accepts data from the detector FE electronics, buffers the data, performs a trigger decision, builds events from the selected data and delivers the result to the offline secondary DAQ buffer.
daq.defLaTeX: The data acquisition system  accepts data from the detector \gls{fe} electronics, buffers  the data, performs a \gls{trigdecision}, builds events from the selected  data and delivers the result to the offline \gls{diskbuffer}

daqbes.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that is generally toward its output end. It is responsible for accepting and executing trigger commands and marshaling the data they address to output storage buffers.
daqbes.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that is generally toward its output end.  It is responsible for accepting and executing trigger commands and marshaling the data they address to output storage buffers

daqbuf.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts full data stream from the corresponding detector unit and retains it sufficiently long for it to be available to produce a data fragment.
daqbuf.defLaTeX: The portion  of the \gls{daqfrag} that accepts full data stream from the  corresponding \gls{detunit} and retains it sufficiently long for it  to be available to produce a \gls{datafrag}

daqccm.defHTML: A system for controlling, configuring and monitoring other systems in particular those that make up the DAQ where the CCM encompasses RC.
daqccm.defLaTeX: A system for controlling, configuring and monitoring other systems in particular those that make up the \gls{daq} where the CCM encompasses \gls{rc}
daqccm.term: DAQ control, configuration and monitoring subsystem
daqccm.termHTML: DAQ control, configuration and monitoring subsystem

daqdfo.defHTML: The process by which trigger commands are executed in parallel and asynchronous manner by the back-end output subsystem of the DAQ.
daqdfo.defLaTeX: The process by which trigger commands are executed in parallel and asynchronous manner by the back-end output subsystem of the \gls{daq}

daqdispre.defHTML: As used in the context of the IPC, a system that provides mechanisms for a node on a communication network to learn of the existence of peers and their identity (discovery) as well as determine if they are currently operational or have become unresponsive (presence).
daqdispre.defLaTeX: As used in the context of the \gls{ipc}, a system that provides mechanisms for a node on a communication network to learn of the existence of peers and their identity (discovery) as well as determine if they are currently operational or have become unresponsive (presence)

daqdr.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the FER, emits trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and forwards the full data stream to the DAQ primary buffer.
daqdr.defLaTeX: The portion of the  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the \gls{daqfer}, emits  trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and  forwards the full data stream to the \gls{daqbuf}

daqds.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts trigger commands and returns the corresponding data fragment. Not to be confused with data selection.
daqds.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daqfrag}  that accepts \glspl{trigcommand} and returns the corresponding  \gls{datafrag}.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqdsn}

daqdsn.defHTML: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the DAQ from the content of the detector data itself. Not to be confused with data selector.
daqdsn.defLaTeX: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the \gls{daq} from the content of the detector data itself.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqds}

daqdss.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream. The majority subset of the DAQ TS.
daqdss.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream.  The majority subset of the \gls{daqtrs}

daqdts.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that provides for timing and synchronization to various detector systems.
daqdts.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that provides for timing and synchronization to various detector systems

daqeti.defHTML: Interface between MTLs and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information.
daqeti.defLaTeX: Interface between \glspl{mtl} and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information

daqfer.defHTML: The portion of a DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the detector electronics and provides it to the DAQ FEC.
daqfer.defLaTeX: The portion of a  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the detector electronics and  provides it to the \gls{fec}

daqfrag.defHTML: The portion of one DAQ partition relating to a single DAQ FEC and corresponding to an integral number of detector units. See also data fragment.
daqfrag.defLaTeX: The portion of one  \gls{daqpart} relating to a single \gls{fec} and corresponding to an  integral number of \glspl{detunit}.  See also \gls{datafrag}

daqoob.defHTML: This component is responsible for dispatching a SNB dump command to all FERs in the far detector module.
daqoob.defLaTeX: This component is responsible for dispatching a \gls{snb} dump  command to all \glspl{daqfer} in the \gls{detmodule}

daqpart.defHTML: A cohesive and coherent collection of DAQ hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of DAQ front-end fragments. Multiple DAQ partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently.
daqpart.defLaTeX: A cohesive and coherent collection of \gls{daq} hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of \glspl{daqfrag}. Multiple \gls{daq} partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently

daqros.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics.
daqros.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics

daqrou.defHTML: The first element in the data flow of the DAQ.
daqrou.defLaTeX: The first element in the data flow of the \gls{daq}

daqrun.defHTML: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and DAQ configuration are asserted to be unchanged. Multiple DAQ runs may occur simultaneously when multiple DAQ partitions are active. This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam "runs" that typically span many DAQ runs.
daqrun.defLaTeX: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and \gls{daq} configuration are asserted to be unchanged.  Multiple \gls{daq} runs may occur simultaneously when multiple \glspl{daqpart} are active.  This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam ``runs'' that typically span many \gls{daq} runs

daqrunnum.defHTML: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a DAQ run.
daqrunnum.defLaTeX: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a \gls{daqrun}

daqtrs.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision.
daqtrs.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision

daqtss.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that provides for timing and synchronization to various components.
daqtss.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that provides for timing and synchronization to various components

daqubi.defHTML: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream DAQ buffers to processes on the network.
daqubi.defLaTeX: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream \gls{daq} buffers to processes on the network

datafrag.defHTML: A block of data read out from a single DAQ front-end fragment thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a trigger command.
datafrag.defLaTeX: A block of data read out from a single \gls{daqfrag} thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a \gls{trigcommand}

dayabay.defHTML: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle Θ13 using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants.
dayabay.defLaTeX: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle $\Theta_{13}$  using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants

dcache.defHTML: A distributed, highly scalable (multi-PB) storage system, usable as both a standalone system and as a high-speed frontend to a tape storage system (such as /pnfs at Fermilab).
dcache.defLaTeX: A distributed, highly scalable (multi-PB) storage system, usable as both a standalone system and as a high-speed frontend to a tape storage system (such as /pnfs at Fermilab)

dcdb.defHTML: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each far detector module.
dcdb.defLaTeX: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each \gls{detmodule}

ddss.defHTML: The hardware system responsible for the safety of the detector, implemented either via a PLC or via custom hardware protections.
ddss.defLaTeX: The hardware system responsible for the safety of the detector, implemented either via a \gls{plc} or via custom hardware protections

detmodule.defHTML: The entire DUNE far detector is segmented into four modules, each with a total/fiducial mass of approximately 17/10.
detmodule.defLaTeX: The entire DUNE far detector is  segmented into four modules, each with a total/fiducial mass of approximately \SI{17}{\kton}/\SI{10}{\kton}

detunit.defHTML: A portion of a far detector module may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts. For example, the FD1-HD TPC is made up of APA units (and other elements).
detunit.defLaTeX: A portion of a \gls{detmodule} may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts.   For example, the \gls{sphd} \gls{tpc} is made up of \gls{apa}  units (and other elements)

dirac.defHTML: Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many HEP experiments.
dirac.defLaTeX: Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many HEP experiments

dis.defHTML: Refers to interaction between elementary particles and a nucleus in an energy range where the interaction can be modeled as occurring between constituent quarks of one nucleon and resulting in no bulk recoil of the resulting nucleus.
dis.defLaTeX: Refers to interaction between  elementary particles and a nucleus in an energy range where the  interaction can be modeled as occurring between constituent quarks  of one nucleon and resulting in no bulk recoil of the resulting  nucleus

diskbuffer.defHTML: A secondary DAQ buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as selected by a trigger command. This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline.
diskbuffer.defLaTeX: A secondary  \gls{daq} buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as  selected by a \gls{trigcommand}.  This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline

dm.defHTML: The term given to the unknown matter or force that explains measurements of galaxy motion that are otherwise inconsistent with the amount of mass associated with the observed amount of photon production.
dm.defLaTeX: The term given to the unknown  matter or force that explains measurements of galaxy motion  that are otherwise inconsistent with the amount of mass associated  with the observed amount of photon production

dnl.defHTML: A commonly used measure of performance in ADCs. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one LSB.
dnl.defLaTeX: A commonly used measure of performance in \glspl{adc}. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one \gls{lsb}

docdb.defHTML: A computerized document management system developed and supported at Fermilab in which most LBNF/DUNE documents are managed (docs.dunescience.org); some documents are maintained in EDMS.
docdb.defLaTeX: A computerized document management system developed and supported at \gls{fnal} in which most \gls{lbnf-dune} documents are managed (docs.dunescience.org); some documents are maintained in \gls{edms}

doecd.defHTML: The U.S. DOE’s Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD).
doecd.defLaTeX: The U.S. DOE's Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD)

doma.defHTML: data organization, management, and access efforts through the HEP Software Foundation.
doma.defLaTeX: data organization, management, and access efforts through the HEP Software Foundation

dp.defHTML: Distinguishes a LArTPC technology by the fact that it operates using argon in both gas and liquid phases; sometimes called double-phase.
dp.defLaTeX: Distinguishes a \gls{lartpc} technology by the fact that it operates using argon in both gas and liquid phases; sometimes called double-phase

dpdfd.defHTML: Deputy Project Director for far detectors.
dpdfd.defLaTeX: Deputy Project Director for far detectors

dqm.defHTML: Analysis of the raw data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be performed in real time, within the DAQ system, or in later stages of processing, using disk files as input.
dqm.defLaTeX: Analysis of the raw  data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the  detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be  performed in real time, within the \gls{daq} system, or in later  stages of processing, using disk files as input

drift.defHTML: (1) refers to electron drift under the influence of an electric field in a TPC; (2) an excavated horizontal corridors (tunnels) in the underground areas at SURF.
drift.defLaTeX: (1) refers to electron drift under the influence of an electric field in a \gls{tpc}; (2) an excavated horizontal corridors (tunnels) in the underground areas at \gls{surf}

dsnb.defHTML: The term describing the pervasive, constant flux of neutrinos due to all past supernova neutrino bursts.
dsnb.defLaTeX: The  term describing the pervasive, constant flux of neutrinos due to all  past supernova neutrino bursts

dsp.defHTML: a single-phase DUNE far detector module.
dsp.defLaTeX: a single-phase DUNE far detector module

dss.defHTML: The system of rails suspended from the cryostat ceiling in a SP module used to support the APAs, CPAs, and the endwall FCs.
dss.defLaTeX: The system of rails suspended from the cryostat ceiling in a \gls{spmod} used to support the \gls{apa}s, \gls{cpa}s, and the \glspl{ewfc}

dumpbuffer.defHTML: This DAQ buffer accepts a high-rate data stream, in aggregate, from an associated portion of a far detector module sufficient to collect all data likely relevant to a potential SNB.
dumpbuffer.defLaTeX: This \gls{daq} buffer  accepts a high-rate data stream, in aggregate, from an associated  portion of a \gls{detmodule} sufficient to collect all data likely relevant to  a potential \gls{snb}

dune.defHTML: A leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and proton decay studies; refers to the entire international experiment and collaboration.
dune.defLaTeX: A leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and proton decay studies; refers to the entire international experiment and collaboration

duneprism.defHTML: a mobile near detector that can perform measurements over a range of angles off-axis from the neutrino beam direction in order to sample many different neutrino energy distributions.
duneprism.defLaTeX: a mobile near detector that can perform measurements over a range of angles off-axis from the neutrino beam direction in order to sample many different neutrino energy distributions

duneus.defHTML: Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; refers to the U.S. contribution to DUNE under the line-item LBNF/DUNE-US project.
duneus.defLaTeX: Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment - United States; refers to the U.S. contribution to DUNE under the line-item \gls{usproj} project

dword.defHTML: A term in the DUNE lexicon.
dword.defLaTeX: A term in the DUNE lexicon

e4nu.defHTML: A collaboration dedicated to using JLab’s electron-scattering data to deliver improved neutrino-nucleus cross sections.
e4nu.defLaTeX: A collaboration dedicated to using JLab's electron-scattering data to deliver improved neutrino-nucleus cross sections

eb.defHTML: A software agent that executes trigger commands for one far detector module by reading out the requested data.
eb.defLaTeX: A software agent that executes \glspl{trigcommand}  for one  \gls{detmodule} by reading out the requested data

ecal.defHTML: A detector component that measures energy deposition of traversing particles (in the near detector conceptual design).
ecal.defLaTeX: A detector  component that measures energy deposition of traversing particles (in the near detector conceptual design)

echain.defHTML: mechanical machine elements used to carry and guide power to moving parts of machines or structures, as required for DUNE-PRISM to carry power, data, and utilities to and from each movable near detector component at any arbitrary position along its travel path.
echain.defLaTeX: mechanical machine elements used to carry and guide power to moving parts of machines or structures, as required for \gls{duneprism} to carry power, data, and utilities to and from each movable near detector component at any arbitrary position along its travel path

edms.defHTML: A computerized document management system developed and supported at CERN in which some project and collaboration documents, drawings and engineering models are managed.
edms.defLaTeX: A computerized document management system developed and supported at \gls{cern} in which some project and collaboration documents, drawings and engineering models are managed

eelaser.defHTML: a laser in which light is emitted from the edge of the substrate.
eelaser.defLaTeX: a laser in which  light is emitted from the edge of the substrate

efig.defHTML: The body that provides a means to coordinate and discuss issues related to the interfaces within and between the facility and the DUNE detectors at both the Fermilab and SURF sites.
efig.defLaTeX: The body that provides a means to coordinate and discuss issues related to the interfaces within and between the facility and the DUNE detectors at both the \gls{fnal} and \gls{surf} sites

ehn1.defHTML: Location at CERN of the NP02 and NP04 areas used for the ProtoDUNEs and for other test and prototyping activities for DUNE.
ehn1.defLaTeX: Location at \gls{cern} of the \gls{np02} and \gls{np04} areas used for the \glspl{protodune} and for other test and prototyping activities for DUNE

elife.defHTML: The attachment of electrons drifting through liquid argon to impurity molecules such as oxygen or water is parameterized by an exponential as a function of time with a time constant called the electron lifetime.
elife.defLaTeX: The attachment of electrons drifting through liquid argon to impurity molecules such as oxygen or water is parameterized by an exponential as a function of time with a time constant called the electron lifetime

emi.defHTML: Disturbance generated by an external source that affects an electrical circuit by electromagnetic induction, electrostatic coupling, or conduction.
emi.defLaTeX: Disturbance generated by an external source that affects an electrical circuit by electromagnetic induction, electrostatic coupling, or conduction

enc.defHTML: The equivalent noise charge is the input charge that corresponds to a S/N = 1.
enc.defLaTeX: The equivalent noise charge is the input charge that corresponds to a \gls{s/n}$=1$

enob.defHTML: The effective number of bits is a measure of the dynamic range of an ADC and its associated circuitry. The resolution of an ADC is specified by the number of bits used to represent the analog value, in principle giving 2N signal levels for an N-bit signal. However, all real ADC circuits introduce noise and distortion. ENOB specifies the resolution of an ideal ADC circuit that would have the same resolution as the circuit under consideration.
enob.defLaTeX: The effective number of bits is a measure of the dynamic range of an \gls{adc} and its associated circuitry. The resolution of an \gls{adc} is specified by the number of bits used to represent the analog value, in principle giving 2N signal levels for an N-bit signal. However, all real \gls{adc} circuits introduce noise and distortion. ENOB specifies the resolution of an ideal \gls{adc} circuit that would have the same resolution as the circuit under consideration

eos.defHTML: The XRootD-based distributed file system developed by CERN.
eos.defLaTeX: The XRootD-based distributed file system developed by CERN

es.defHTML: Events in which a neutrinoelastically scatters off of another particle.
es.defLaTeX: Events in which a neutrinoelastically scatters off of another particle

esh.defHTML: A discipline and specialty that studies and implements practical aspects of environmental protection and safety at work.
esh.defLaTeX: A discipline and specialty that studies and implements practical aspects of environmental protection and safety at work

espp.defHTML: Thecornerstone of Europe’sdecision-making process for the long-term future of thefield. Mandated by the CERN Council, it is formed through a broadconsultation of the grass-roots particle physics community, itactively solicits the opinions of physicists from around the world,and it is developed in close coordination with similar processes inthe USA and Japan in order to ensure coordination between regions andoptimal use of resources globally.
espp.defLaTeX: Thecornerstone of Europe'sdecision-making process for the long-term future of thefield. Mandated by the \gls{cern} Council, it is formed through a broadconsultation of the grass-roots particle physics community, itactively solicits the opinions of physicists from around the world,and it is developed in close coordination with similar processes inthe USA and Japan in order to ensure coordination between regions andoptimal use of resources globally

etf.defHTML: WLCG testing middleware running grid jobs that actively test distributed sites services and capabilities, and report back to monitoring services.
etf.defLaTeX: \gls{wlcg} testing middleware running grid jobs that actively test distributed sites services and capabilities, and report back to monitoring services

etl.defHTML: Trigger processing that consumes far detector module level trigger notification information and other global sources of trigger input and emits trigger command information back to the MTLs.
etl.defLaTeX: Trigger processing  that consumes \gls{detmodule} level \gls{trignote} information  and other global sources of trigger input and emits  \gls{trigcommand} information back to the \glspl{mtl}

evms.defHTML: Earned Value Management is a systematic approach to the integration and measurement of cost, schedule, and technical (scope) accomplishments on a project or task. It provides both the government and contractors the ability to examine detailed schedule information, critical program and technical milestones, and cost data (text from the US DOE); the EVMS is a system that implements this approach.
evms.defLaTeX: Earned Value Management is a systematic approach to the integration and measurement of cost, schedule, and technical (scope) accomplishments on a project or task. It provides both the government and contractors the ability to examine detailed schedule information, critical program and technical milestones, and cost data (text from the US DOE); the EVMS is a system that implements this approach

exb.defHTML: The highest level DUNE decision-making body for the collaboration.
exb.defLaTeX: The highest level DUNE  decision-making body for the collaboration

exposure.defHTML: The integrated detector fiducial mass times beam intensity; it is proportional to the number of interactions and is used to normalize cross sections in a data sample.
exposure.defLaTeX: The integrated detector fiducial mass times beam intensity; it is proportional to the number of interactions and is used to normalize cross sections in a data sample

fd.defLaTeX: The \SI{70}{kt} total (\fdfiducialmass fiducial) mass \gls{lartpc} DUNE detector, composed of four \larmass total (\nominalmodsize fiducial) mass modules,  to be installed at the far site at \gls{surf} in  Lead, SD, USA

fd1c.defHTML: The first far detector module to be built at SURF, including integration and installation, and all cryogenics infrastructure to support FD1 and FD2; also a subproject of LBNF/DUNE-US.

fdr.defLaTeX: Depending on context, either ``final design report,'' a formal project document  that describes the experiment at a final level, or ``final design review,'' a formal review of the final design of the experiment or of a component

fe.defLaTeX: The front-end refers to a point that is  ``upstream'' of the data flow for a particular subsystem. fea.defLaTeX: Simulation of a physical phenomenon using the numerical technique called Finite Element Method (FEM), a numerical method for solving problems of engineering and mathematical physics

fec.defLaTeX: The portion of one  \gls{daqpart} that hosts the \gls{daqdr}, \gls{daqbuf} and  \gls{daqds}.  It hosts the \gls{daqfer} and corresponding portion of the \gls{daqbuf}

fifemon.defLaTeX: Comprehensive suite of job and storage monitoring information available for most Fermilab experiments, including DUNE

fra.defLaTeX: A joint partnership of the University of Chicago and the Universities Research Association (URA) that manages and operates Fermilab on behalf of the \gls{doe}

hdpe.defHTML: A thermoplastic polymer made from petroleum commonly used to make plastic bottles.
hdpe.defLaTeX: A thermoplastic polymer made from petroleum commonly used to make plastic bottles

hpg.defLaTeX: gas at high pressure to be used in a \gls{hpgtpc}

hv.defHTML: Generally describes a voltage applied to drive the motion of free electrons through some media, e.g., LAr.

hvs.defLaTeX: The detector  subsystem that provides the \gls{tpc} drift field

hyperk.defLaTeX: 260 kt water Cerenkov neutrino detector to begin construction at Kamiokande in 2020

iandi.defLaTeX: One of the three project areas in the LBNF/DUNE-US \gls{doe} project, along with LBNF and DUNE-US

ib.defLaTeX: institutional board; all institutions participating in DUNE are represented on this board

icarus.defHTML: A neutrino experiment that was located at the Laboratori Nazionali del Gran Sasso (LNGS) in Italy, then refurbished at CERN for re-use in the same neutrino beam from Fermilab used by the MiniBooNE , MicroBooNE and SBND experiments at Fermilab.

iceberg.defHTML: Integrated Cryostat and Electronics Built for Experimental Research Goals: a double-walled cryostat built and installed at Fermilabfor liquid argon detector R&D and for testing of DUNE detector components.

ieshp.defLaTeX: integrated environmental, safety and health plan

ifbeam.defHTML: Database that stores beamline information indexed by timestamp.

ifdh.defLaTeX: The actual command invoked when using \gls{ifdhc}, on the command line, e.g. ifdh cp source\_file dest\_file

ifdhc.defLaTeX: A multi-protocol tool for data transfer and file delivery in jobs. It is able to automatically select transfer protocols based on source and destination characteristics

ific.defHTML: Instituto de Fisica Corpuscular (in Valencia, Spain).
ific.defLaTeX: Instituto de Fisica Corpuscular (in Valencia, Spain)

ih.defHTML: Refers to the neutrino mass eigenstate ordering whereby the sign of the mass squared difference associated with the atmospheric neutrino problem is negative.
ih.defLaTeX: Refers to the neutrino mass  eigenstate ordering whereby the sign of the mass squared difference  associated with the atmospheric neutrino problem is negative

ims.defLaTeX: A project management device consisting of linked tasks and milestones

inc.defLaTeX: A highest-level international advisory body to the U.S. \gls{doe} and the  \gls{fnal} directorate on matters related to the  \gls{lbnf} and the  \gls{pip2} projects. ingaas.defHTML: Indium gallium arsenide is a room-temperature semiconductor commonly used as a high-speed, high-sensitivity photodetector for optical fiber telecommunications.
ingaas.defLaTeX: Indium gallium arsenide is a room-temperature semiconductor commonly used as a high-speed, high-sensitivity photodetector for optical fiber telecommunications

inl.defLaTeX: A commonly used measure of performance in \glspl{adc}. It is the deviation between the ideal input threshold value and the measured threshold level of a certain output code

integoff.defHTML: The DOE project element that organizes the onsite teams responsible for coordinating far detector installation and detector-facility integration activities at SURF as well as near detector installation activities at Fermilab. The integration project office includes overall LBNF/DUNE systems engineering, compliance and review offices.
integoff.defLaTeX: The \gls{doe} project element that organizes the onsite teams responsible for coordinating far detector installation and detector-facility integration activities at \gls{surf} as well as near detector installation activities at \gls{fnal}.  The integration project office includes overall LBNF/DUNE systems engineering, compliance and review offices

intlproj.defHTML: The international project to design and build the facilities and detectors for the LBNF/DUNE; it includes the LBNF/DUNE-US and projects at multiple international partners to manage the contributions from non-US institutions and funding agencies to design, build, and install the detector components.
intlproj.defLaTeX: The international project to design and build the facilities and detectors for the \gls{lbnf-dune}; it includes the \gls{usproj} and projects at multiple international partners to manage the contributions from non-US institutions and funding agencies to design, build, and install the detector components

io.defHTML: Refers to the neutrino mass eigenstate ordering whereby the sign of the mass squared difference associated with the atmospheric neutrino problem is negative.
io.defLaTeX: Refers to the neutrino mass  eigenstate ordering whereby the sign of the mass squared difference  associated with the atmospheric neutrino problem is negative

iov.defHTML: Interval over which something is valid.
iov.defLaTeX: Interval over which something is valid

ipc.defLaTeX: A system for software elements to exchange information between threads, local processes or across a data network.  An IPC system is typically specified in terms of protocols  composed of message types and their associated data schema

ipd.defHTML: Responsible for integration and installation of DUNE detector deliverables. Manages the integration project.
ipd.defLaTeX: Responsible for integration and installation of DUNE detector deliverables. Manages the integration project

irig.defHTML: A standards body that defined a time-code standard for transferring timing information.
irig.defLaTeX: A standards body that defined a time-code standard for transferring timing information

iroc.defHTML: inner (radial) readout chamber for gaseous argon TPC.
iroc.defLaTeX: inner (radial) readout chamber for gaseous argon \gls{tpc}

irr.defHTML: A project management mechanism by which the plan for installation is reviewed.
irr.defLaTeX: A project management mechanism by which the plan for installation is reviewed

jpo.defHTML: The framework used to facilitate close and coherent coordination across all elements with many shared management resources;JPO functions include systems engineering, procurement, ES&H, QA, finance, project controls, risk management, compliance, internal reviews, partner agreement management, document management, and administrative support.
jpo.defLaTeX: The framework used to facilitate close and coherent coordination across all elements with many shared management resources;JPO functions include systems engineering, procurement, \gls{esh}, \gls{qa}, finance, project controls, risk management, compliance, internal reviews, partner agreement management, document management, and administrative support

kapton.defHTML: A polyimide plastic film that is stable over a broad range of temperatures and is resistant to radiation damage.
kapton.defLaTeX: A polyimide plastic film that is stable over a broad range of temperatures and is resistant to radiation damage

kloe.defHTML: KLOE is a e+e− collider detector spectrometer operated at DAFNE, the ϕ-meson factory at Frascati, Rome. In DUNE it will consist of a 26 cm Pb+scintillating fiber ECAL surrounding a cylindrical open detector region that is 4.00 m in diameter and 4.30 m long. The ECAL and detector region are embedded in a 0.6 T magnetic field created by a 4.86 m diameter superconducting coil and a 475 tonne iron yoke.
kloe.defLaTeX: KLOE is a $e^+ e^-$ collider detector spectrometer operated at DAFNE, the $\phi$-meson factory at Frascati, Rome. In DUNE it will consist of a \SI{26}{cm} Pb+scintillating fiber ECAL surrounding a cylindrical open detector region that is  \SI{4.00}{m} in diameter and \SI{4.30}{m} long. The ECAL and detector region are embedded in a \SI{0.6}{T} magnetic field created by a \SI{4.86}{m} diameter superconducting coil and a \SI{475}{tonne} iron yoke

labview.defHTML: Laboratory Virtual Instrument Engineering Workbench is a system-design platform and development environment for a visual programming language from National Instruments.
labview.defLaTeX: Laboratory Virtual Instrument Engineering Workbench is a system-design platform and development environment for a visual programming language from National Instruments

lanl.defHTML: US national laboratory in Los Alamos, NM.
lanl.defLaTeX: US national laboratory in Los Alamos, NM

lapd.defHTML: Cryostat at Fermilab for long-term studies requiring a large volume of argon.
lapd.defLaTeX: Cryostat at Fermilab for long-term studies requiring a large volume of argon

lar.defHTML: Argon in its liquid phase; it is a cryogenic liquid with a boiling point of 87 K and density of 1.4 g/ml.
lar.defLaTeX: Argon in its liquid phase; it is a cryogenic liquid with a boiling point of \SI{87}{K} and density of \SI{1.4}{g/ml}

larasic.defHTML: A 16-channel FE ASIC that provides signal amplification and pulse shaping.
larasic.defLaTeX: A 16-channel \gls{fe} \gls{asic} that provides signal amplification and pulse shaping

lariat.defHTML: The repurposed ArgoNeuT LArTPC, modified for use in a charged particle beam, dedicated to the calibration and precise characterization of the output response of these detectors.
lariat.defLaTeX: The repurposed ArgoNeuT \gls{lartpc}, modified for use in a charged particle beam, dedicated to the calibration and precise characterization of the output response of these detectors

larpix.defHTML: ASIC pixelated charge readout for a TPC.

larsoft.defHTML: A shared base of physics software across LArTPC experiments.
larsoft.defLaTeX: A shared base of physics software across \gls{lartpc} experiments

lartpc.defHTML: A TPC filled with liquid argon;the basis for the DUNE FD modules.
lartpc.defLaTeX: A \gls{tpc} filled with liquid argon;the basis for the \gls{dune} \gls{fd} modules

lbl.defLaTeX: Refers to the distance between the  neutrino source  and the \gls{fd}.  It can also refer to the distance between the near and far detectors.  The ``long'' designation is an approximate and relative distinction. For DUNE, this distance  (between \gls{fnal} and \gls{surf}) is approximately \SI{1300}{km}

lbls.defHTML: Auxiliary calibration system providing an independent location measurement of the ionization laser beams direction.
lbls.defLaTeX: Auxiliary calibration system providing an independent location measurement of the ionization laser beams direction

lbnc.defHTML: The committee, composed of internationally prominent scientists with relevant expertise, charged by the Fermilab director to review the scientific, technical, and managerial progress, plans and decisions associated with DUNE.
lbnc.defLaTeX: The committee, composed of internationally prominent scientists with relevant expertise, charged by the \gls{fnal} director to review the scientific, technical, and managerial progress, plans and decisions associated with \gls{dune}

lbne.defHTML: Long Baseline Neutrino Experiment; (1) a terminated U.S. experiment that was reformulated in 2014 under the auspices of the new DUNE collaboration, an internationally coordinated and internationally funded program, with Fermilab as host; and (2) the former incarnation of LBNF/DUNE-US.
lbne.defLaTeX: Long Baseline Neutrino Experiment; (1) a terminated U.S. experiment that was reformulated in 2014 under the auspices of the new \gls{dune} collaboration, an internationally coordinated and internationally funded program, with \gls{fnal} as host; and (2) the former incarnation of \gls{usproj}

lbnf.defHTML: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility; refers to the facilities that support the experiment including in-kind contributions under the line-item project. The portion of LBNF/DUNE-US responsible for developing the neutrino beam, the far site cryostats, and far and near site cryogenics systems, and the conventional facilities, including the excavations.
lbnf.defLaTeX: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility; refers to the facilities that support the experiment including in-kind contributions under the line-item project. The portion of \gls{usproj} responsible for developing the neutrino beam, the far site cryostats,  and far and near site cryogenics systems, and the conventional facilities, including the excavations

lbnf-dune.defHTML: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment; refers to the overall enterprise or program including LBNF/DUNE-US, participating international projects, and the DUNE experiment and collaboration.
lbnf-dune.defLaTeX: Long-Baseline Neutrino Facility/Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment; refers to the overall enterprise or program including \gls{usproj}, participating international projects, and the \gls{dune} experiment and collaboration

lbnfspac.defHTML: A committee charged by the host laboratory director to provide expert, independent advice on significant issues and strategies related to LBNF/DUNE-US project organization, management, and risks.
lbnfspac.defLaTeX: A committee charged by the host laboratory director to provide expert, independent advice on significant issues and strategies related to \gls{usproj} project organization, management, and risks

lbnfspac.termHTML: LBNF / DUNE-US Strategic Project Advisory Committee

lbnl.defHTML: US national laboratory in Berkeley, CA.
lbnl.defLaTeX: US national laboratory in Berkeley, CA

lbno.defHTML: A terminated European project that, during its six-year duration, assessed the feasibility of a next-generation deep underground neutrino observatory in Europe).
lbno.defLaTeX: A terminated European project that, during its six-year duration, assessed the feasibility of a next-generation deep underground neutrino observatory in Europe)

ldm.defHTML: Refers to dark matter particles with mass values much lower than the electroweak scale, specifically below the 1 GeV level.
ldm.defLaTeX: Refers to dark matter particles with mass values much lower than the electroweak scale, specifically below the 1~GeV level

ldmx.defHTML: The LDMX detector concept consists of a small precision tracker, and electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters, all with near 2π azimuthal acceptance from the forward beam axis out to  ∼ 40∘ angle. This detector would be capable of measuring correlations among electrons, pions, protons, and neutrons in electron-nucleus scattering at exactly the energies relevant for DUNE physics.
ldmx.defLaTeX: The LDMX detector concept consists of a small precision tracker, and electromagnetic and hadronic calorimeters, all with near $2\pi$ azimuthal acceptance from the forward beam axis out to $\sim40^\circ$ angle. This detector would be capable of measuring correlations among electrons, pions, protons, and neutrons in electron-nucleus scattering at exactly the energies relevant for DUNE physics

ldo.defHTML: A low-dropout or LDO regulator is a DC linear voltage regulator that can regulate the output voltage even when the supply voltage is very close to the output voltage.
ldo.defLaTeX: A low-dropout or LDO regulator is a \gls{dc} linear voltage regulator that can regulate the output voltage even when the supply voltage is very close to the output voltage

lem.defHTML: A micro-pattern detector suitable for use in ultra-pure argon vapor; LEMs consist of copper-clad PCB boards with sub-millimeter-size holes through which electrons undergo amplification.
lem.defLaTeX: A micro-pattern detector suitable for use in ultra-pure argon vapor; LEMs consist of copper-clad PCB boards with sub-millimeter-size holes through which electrons undergo amplification

lhcb.defHTML: LHC experiment dedicated to forward physics.
lhcb.defLaTeX: LHC experiment dedicated to forward physics

lng.defHTML: Pertaining to natural gas in its liquid phase.
lng.defLaTeX: Pertaining to natural gas in its liquid phase

lro.defHTML: The system for detecting scintillation photons in a LArTPC detector module.
lro.defLaTeX: The system for detecting  scintillation photons in a \gls{lartpc} detector module

lsb.defHTML: The bit with the lowest numerical value in a binary number.
lsb.defLaTeX: The bit with the lowest numerical value in a binary number

lsnd.defHTML: A scintillation detector and associated experiment located at Los Alamos National Laboratory.
lsnd.defLaTeX: A scintillation detector and associated experiment located at Los Alamos National Laboratory

lsst.defHTML: 8.4 m telescope with 3.2G-pixel camera that will start taking data in 2023.
lsst.defLaTeX: 8.4 m telescope with 3.2G-pixel camera that will start taking data in 2023

lux.defHTML: Large Underground Xenon (LUX) dark matter detector at SURF.
lux.defLaTeX: Large Underground Xenon (LUX) dark matter detector at \gls{surf}

ly.defHTML: detected photons per unit deposited energy.
ly.defLaTeX: detected photons per unit deposited energy

lz.defHTML: Experiment sited at SURF that seeks to detect faint interactions between galactic dark matter and regular matter.
lz.defLaTeX: Experiment sited at \gls{surf} that  seeks to detect faint interactions between galactic dark matter and regular matter

marley.defLaTeX: Developed at UC Davis, MARLEY is the first realistic model of neutrino electron interactions on argon for enegies less than \SI{50}{MeV}. This includes the energy range important for \gls{snb} neutrinos and also solar 8--boron neutrinos
marley.term: Model of Argon Reaction Low Energy Yields
marley.termHTML: Model of Argon Reaction Low Energy Yields

mc.defLaTeX: Refers to a method of numerical  integration that entails the statistical sampling of the integrand  function.  Forms the basis for some types of detector and physics simulations

mcr.defHTML: Space at the FD site for cyber infrastructure.
mcr.defLaTeX: Space at the \gls{fd} site for cyber infrastructure

mec.defLaTeX: An nuclear effect wherein pairs or larger groups of nucleons within a nucleus are bound together through the exchange of pions or other mesons. Neutrinos and other particles can scatter from these correlated pairs

mh.defHTML: Describes the separation between the mass squared differences related to the solar and atmospheric neutrino problems (also written as MO).
mh.defLaTeX: Describes the separation  between the mass squared differences related to the solar and  atmospheric neutrino problems (also written as \gls{mo})

mi.defHTML: An accelerator at Fermilab that provides a beam of high-energy protons to the the LBNF/DUNE-US beamline.
mi.defLaTeX: An accelerator at  \gls{fnal} that provides a beam of high-energy protons to the the \gls{usproj}  beamline

microboone.defHTML: A LArTPC neutrino oscillation experiment at Fermilab.

minerva.defHTML: Neutrino cross sections experiment at Fermilab.

miniboone.defHTML: The Mini Booster Neutrino Experiment, at Fermilab, was designed to fully explore the LSND result.
miniboone.defLaTeX: The Mini Booster Neutrino Experiment, at Fermilab, was designed to fully explore the LSND result

minipod.defHTML: a family of types of multi-channel optical transceivers.
minipod.defLaTeX: a family of types of multi-channel optical transceivers

minos.defHTML: A long-baseline neutrino experiment, with a near detector at Fermilab and a far detector in the Soudan mine in Minnesota, designed to observe the phenomena of neutrino oscillations (ended data runs in 2012).
minos.defLaTeX: A long-baseline neutrino experiment, with a near detector at \gls{fnal} and a far detector in the Soudan mine in Minnesota, designed to observe the phenomena of neutrino oscillations (ended data runs in 2012)

minosplus.defHTML: The successor to the MINOS experiment, utilizing the same detectors and beam line, but operating at higher beam energy tune than MINOS, parasitic with NOvA.

mip.defHTML: Refers to a particle traversing some medium such that the particle’s mean energy loss is near the minimum.
mip.defLaTeX: Refers to a  particle traversing some medium such that the particle's mean energy loss is  near the minimum

miso.defHTML: The Master In Slave Out is a logicsignal on the SPI bus on which the data from the slave are transmitted oncea request from the master is received.
miso.defLaTeX: The Master In Slave Out is a logicsignal on the \gls{spi} bus on which the data from the slave are transmitted oncea request from the master is received

moa.defHTML: A project management methodology that documents an agreement between Fermilab and the LBNF/DUNE-US Project for how Fermilab will support the project.
moa.defLaTeX: A project management methodology that documents an agreement between \gls{fnal} and the LBNF/DUNE-US Project for how Fermilab will support the project

mod0.defHTML: The final pre-production instance of a detector; for the DUNE far detector modules, these will use the 800 t cryostats in NP02 and NP04.

module.defHTML: Many aspects of the DUNE far and near detectors are modular, so "module" must be understood in context. It may refer to one of the four far detector modules, distinct portions of a subdetector as in a "field cage module," a software or electronics module, e.g., a separate framework plug-in, and so on.
module.defLaTeX: Many aspects of the DUNE far and near detectors are modular, so ``module'' must be understood in context. mosi.defLaTeX: The Master Out Slave In is a logicsignal on the \gls{spi} bus on which the data from the master is transmitted

mou.defHTML: A project management methodology that documents an agreement between Fermilab and the LBNF/DUNE-US Project for how Fermilab will support the project. More generally, a document summarizing an agreement between two or more parties.
mou.defLaTeX: A project management methodology that documents an agreement between \gls{fnal} and the LBNF/DUNE-US Project for how Fermilab will support the project. More generally, a document  summarizing an agreement between two or more parties

mpd.defHTML: A component of the near detector conceptual design; it is a magnetized system consisting of a HPgTPC and a surrounding ECAL.

mppc.defHTML: 6 mm×6 mm Multi-Pixel Photon Counters produced by Hamamatsu Photonics K.K.

mrb.defLaTeX: A Fermilab-developed build system based on \dword{cmake} that allows development and builds of code from multiple repositories
